summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors. The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Jeffrey Epstein from 1994-1997 to recruit, groom, and transport underage girls for sexual abuse at multiple properties, and committed perjury in 2016 by lying about her involvement under oath.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of underage girls from 1994-1997.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator of sexual abuse against minor girls, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state lines for sexual abuse, with Maxwell managing Epstein's properties and participating in grooming and abuse.
Had an intimate relationship from approximately 1994-1997 and were photographed together on multiple occasions.
Maxwell groomed and participated in sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1 when she was approximately 14 years old, including group sexual encounters with Epstein.
Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico in 1996 by giving her an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.
Maxwell groomed and introduced Minor Victim-3 to Epstein in London between 1994-1995, encouraging massages knowing Epstein would sexually abuse her.

events.title: Conspiracy to Abuse Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls as young as 14 at various Epstein properties.

events.title: Transport of Minor Victim-1 from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for sexual abuse at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided Minor Victim-2 with an unsolicited topless massage at Epstein's New Mexico ranch as part of grooming for sexual abuse.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London and introduced her to Epstein, encouraging massages that led to sexual abuse.

events.title: First Perjury Deposition
events.description: Maxwell gave false testimony under oath in a civil deposition, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls for sexual massages.

events.title: Second Perjury Deposition
events.description: Maxwell gave false testimony under oath about sex toys at Epstein's properties, her knowledge of his sexual activities with others, and whether she gave massages.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on six counts including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transportation of minors, and perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein sexually abused girls as young as 14 from 1994-1997 at properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.
Maxwell repeatedly lied under oath in 2016 depositions, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme and her own involvement in giving massages.
Three specific minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) are described with detailed allegations of grooming and abuse.
Maxwell's role included befriending victims, normalizing sexual conduct, participating in group sexual encounters, and arranging interstate travel for abuse.
